indications: Indications threadworm, roundworm, whipworm, and hookworm infections
name: MEBENDAZOLE
cautions:
Cautions interactions: Appendix 1 (mebendazole)Note The package insert in the Vermox® pack includes the statement that it is not suitable for women known
to be pregnant or children under 2 years
side-effects:
Side-effects abdominal pain; less commonly diarrhoea, flatulence; rarely hepatitis,
convulsions, dizziness, neutropenia, urticaria, alopecia, rash (including
Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis)
doses:
Threadworms, adult and child over 2 years, 100 mg as a single dose; if reinfection
occurs second dose may be needed after 2 weeks; child under 2 years, see BNF for Children
Whipworms, adult and child over 2 years, 100 mg twice daily for 3 days; child under 2 years, see BNF for Children
pregnancy: Pregnancy manufacturer advises toxicity in animal studies
